verbs.description: unring (third-person singular simple present unrings, present participle unringing, simple past unrang, past participle unrung)

entries.meaning: Hypothetically, to reverse the act of ringing, or the consequences of the action.
examples: In a criminal trial, if the prosecution brings in inadmissible evidence that would unfairly prejudice the accused, a mistrial may be warranted. Having the judge admonish the jury to disregard the evidence might not be enough, as the saying goes, 'You can't unring the bell.'

verbs.description: unring (third-person singular simple present unrings, present participle unringing, simple past and past participle unringed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, poetic) To remove a ring from.
examples: Her lofty song commands in thrilling strainsThat new-raised woman snap her rusty chains,Unring her finger and unbind her breast.
